stories.title: Trump announces lawsuits aimed at social media companies alleging censorship

stories.text: I'm slowly becoming addicted to Emacs, and I'm curious about what everyone else is doing. What are some of your favorite hacks and changes you've implemented over the years?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the weirdest/best thing you've done with Emacs?
All the Countries Where Bitcoin Adoption Is Being Considered
Native Implementation of Mutable Value Semantics

stories.text:
I have always had a dream of having a self-built blog where I share what I learn. Not for any ulterior motives but just to share my experiences, as I do not like the ecosystem social media platforms have built.

But now, that I am all setup and have written a few articles, I am concerned if I should be spending time writing articles just for fun. All the "blogging as a career" content out there seems to make me feel like aspiring to just blog as a hobby is a pipe-dream.

So I want to ask, is anyone out there blogging for fun anymore?
stories.title: Should junior developers blog about what they learn?
